Job Posting: 176606 - Position: S26 Business Ops Analyst Co-op/Intern (28314) 176606 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/16/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/06/2026 05:22 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Nokia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Business Ops Analyst Co-op/Intern (28314) 176606 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $41,184 to $96,356 per year Your responsibilities As a part of our team, you will: • Support insight into how customers interact with our software to help inform process improvements. • Collaborate with Business Operations managers, BG/PG testers, and users to enhance software delivery process requirements and best practices. • Develop automated reporting tools for software delivery across various systems Contribute to a dynamic and interactive team-based environment. • Job Requirements Your skills and experience • Currently a candidate for a Master's, Bachelor's degree, or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, or a related field with an accredited school in Canada. • Strong skills in identifying patterns, drawing insights, and solving problems • Proficiency in programming (e.g., Java, Python, etc.) • Experience with Excel and other data management tools at a master's level • A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and tools The ability to present and explain ideas effectively to teammates and stakeholders • It would be nice if you also had: • Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI, KNIME, Tableau, R, Alteryx, or similar tools • Experience accessing databases via APIs • An interest in or knowledge of Generative AI (GenAI) and Large Language Models (LLM) More information Some of our benefits for students in Canada: • Flexible and hybrid working schemes to balance work and life • Professional development events and networking opportunities • Campus perks designed to make your student experience enjoyable and social, such as access to an onsite cafeteria, free employee parking, complimentary fitness centre, and sports facilities (volleyball, basketball, pickleball courts, ping pong, and employee leagues) • Well-being programs, including Personal Support Service 24/7 - a confidential support channel open to all Nokia employees and their families in challenging situations • Opportunities to join Nokia Employee Resource Groups (NERGs) and connect with people who share your passions and values • Employee Growth Solutions, mentorship programs, and coaching support for your career development • A learning environment that fosters both personal growth and professional development - for your role and beyond Disclaimer for US/Canada Nokia maintains broad annual base salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience and market conditions, and with consideration to internal peer equity. Check the salary ranges in the job info section for this role. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://jobs.nokia.com/en/sites/CX_1/job/28314/?keyword=28314&mode=location Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
